bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, August 15, 1941

div1.p: Kean makes a correction for Hench's publication on the conquerors of yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, August 15, 1941
div1.opener:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
Aug 15
My dear Dr. Hench
div1.p:
As the paper in the Conquerors
of Yellow Fever does not appear in
Hygeia until October there is time
to correct the statement which ap-
peared with picture as published
in the N. Y. Mirror that I was the
“head of the U. S. military hospital
in Havana” As you know I never held
that position and at the time of
Carroll's inoculation I was Chief
Surgeon, Dept. of Western Cuba.

I have run across an extract from
the Report of the Sec'y of War Elihu
Root to Congress for the fiscal year
1901-2 about this episode which
I send you herewith for your
records. I have a copy of it &
it in a way puts me in the
picture. If you will get me a
couple of these reprints of
your paper for my children I
will appreciate it greatly.

closer.seg:
You will see that Walter Reed never
received the reward recommended for
him as the report of the Secy was in the
hands of the printer when he died
Sunday morning at 2.05 a.m. Nov. 23, 1902
I told him of it as I have heard it but he
Frowned & said “I dont care for that now”
So Gorgas was given the Colonelcy
